Y'ALL.Definition: you-all, used to address a group of people that you are speaking to

AIN'T.Definition: contraction of am not, is not, are not, has not, or have not

DELIVER.Definition: to give, direct, or aim something

CONTEXT.Definition: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

REAL WORLD.Definition: happening in the world or in someone's life rather than in a book, in the imagination, on the internet, etc.

COMPREHENSION.Definition: the ability to understand completely and be familiar with a situation, facts, etc.

CULTURAL.Definition: relating to the habits, traditions, and beliefs of a society

ASPECT.Definition: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.

CONJUGATIONS.Definition: the complete set of grammatical forms of a verb

TRIPPIN.Definition: be behaving in an irrational or crazy way

CHILL.Definition: to calm down : go easy : relax

TECHNICALLY.Definition: with regard to or in accordance with a strict or literal interpretation of something (such as a rule, a term, or an official description or designation)

NECESSARILY.Definition: used in negatives to mean 'in every case' or 'therefore'

INVOLVE.Definition: if an activity, situation, etc. involves something, that thing is a part of the activity, etc.

STANDARD.Definition: a pattern or model that is generally accepted

TRASH.Definition: something that is of low quality

WHINING.Definition: if you whine, especially as a child, you complain or express disappointment or unhappiness repeatedly

BRUH.Definition: used as a friendly way of addressing a man or boy

DIALECT.Definition: a regional variety of language distinguished by features of vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation from other regional varieties and constituting together with them a single language

COMPASSION.Definition: a strong feeling of sympathy and sadness for the suffering or bad luck of others and a wish to help them

COMMON GROUND.Definition: shared interests, beliefs, or opinions between two people or groups of people who disagree about most other subjects

DALAI LAMA.Definition: the spiritual head of Tibetan Buddhism

WONDERING.Definition: to ask yourself questions or express a wish to know about something

SCRUTINY.Definition: the careful and detailed examination of something in order to get information about it

PSYCHOLOGICAL.Definition: relating to the human mind and feelings

MAKEUP.Definition: a combination of things that form something

WITHSTAND.Definition: to be strong enough, or not be changed by something, or to oppose a person or thing successfully

REVOLUTION.Definition: a change in the way a country is governed, usually to a different political system and often using violence or war

CATCH.Definition: to manage to hear or see something, so you understand or remember it

LICENSES.Definition: an official document that gives you permission to own, do, or use something

ECONOMIC MOAT.Definition: a metaphor that refers to businesses being able to maintain a competitive advantage over their competitors in order to preserve market share and profits; any method that a company uses to maintain a competitive edge can be considered an economic moat

GIVING OUT.Definition: to give something to each of a number of people

APPARENTLY.Definition: used when the real situation is different from what you thought it was

ATTAIN.Definition: to achieve something difficult to do or obtain

THEORY.Definition: a statement of an opinion or an explanation of an idea that is believed to be true, but might be wrong

COHERENTLY.Definition: in a way that is clear and carefully considered, with each part connecting or following in a natural or sensible way

LINGUISTIC.Definition: connected with language or the study of language

CHARACTERISTICS.Definition: a typical or noticeable quality of someone or something

CONFLICTING.Definition: relating to beliefs, needs, facts, etc. that are different and opposing

GRAMMATICALLY.Definition: in a way that relates to grammar or obeying the rules of grammar

CONTRACTIONS.Definition: a short form of a word or combination of words that is often used instead of the full form in spoken English

AUXILIARY VERBS.Definition: a verb that gives grammatical information not given by the main verb of a sentence

USAGE.Definition: the way a particular word in a language, or a language in general, is used

CONVEY.Definition: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people

INTENDED.Definition: to have as a plan or purpose

SENSE.Definition: the ability to make reasonable judgments

NATIVE SPEAKER'S.Definition: someone who has spoken a particular language since they were a baby, rather than having learned it as a child or adult

RECOGNIZE.Definition: to know someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before

LINGUISTS.Definition: someone who studies foreign languages or can speak them very well, or someone who teaches or studies linguistics

DRAW.Definition: to make or show a comparison between things

DISTINCTION.Definition: a difference between two similar things

CONTROVERSY.Definition: a lot of disagreement or argument about something, usually because it affects or is important to many people

INDUSTRY.Definition: the people and activities involved in one type of business

STIGMATIZED.Definition: to treat someone or something unfairly by disapproving of him, her, or it

SOCIOECONOMIC.Definition: related to the differences between groups of people caused mainly by their financial situation

IN MY HUMBLE OPINION.Definition: phrase used to present one's viewpoint or beliefs with an awareness or cautiousness that the listener might disagree or be offended

ELITIST'S.Definition: regarding other people as inferior because they lack power, wealth, or status; a person who is or regards himself or herself as a member of a socially elite group

SEGREGATING.Definition: to cause or force the separation of (as from the rest of society)

CHARACTER.Definition: the particular combination of qualities in a person or place that makes them different from others

OBVIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that is easy to understand or see

SUBJECTIVE.Definition: influenced by or based on personal beliefs or feelings, rather than based on facts

DETERMINE.Definition: to discover the facts or truth about something

SLANG.Definition: very informal language that is usually spoken rather than written, used especially by particular groups of people

BLACK.Definition: relating or belonging to people with black or dark brown skin, especially people who live in Africa or whose family originally came from Africa

INTERPRET.Definition: to decide what the intended meaning of something is

SNOBBY.Definition: a person who respects and likes only people who are of a high social class, and/or a person who has extremely high standards who is not satisfied by the things that ordinary people like

IDIOMS.Definition: a group of words in a fixed order that has a particular meaning that is different from the meanings of each word on its own

INTERNALIZE.Definition: to accept or absorb an idea, opinion, belief, etc. so that it becomes part of your character

IMPACT.Definition: a powerful effect that something, especially something new, has on a situation or person
